Cell Division.name: Cell Division
Cell Division.blurb: Each time Zac hits an enemy with an ability, he sheds a chunk of himself that can be reabsorbed to restore Health. Upon taking fatal damage, Zac splits into 4 bloblets that attempt to recombine. If any bloblets remain, he will revive with an amount of Health depending on the Health of the surviving bloblets. Each bloblet has a percentage of Zac's maximum Health, Armor and Magic Resistance. This ability has a 5 minute cooldown.
Cell Division.description: The Secret Weapon: Zac's size scales with  his current health, getting larger when it exceeds  his base health and getting smaller the higher  his missing health.
Cell Division.description2: Innate - Goo: Every time Zac damages at least one enemy with an ability, he sheds, depending on the ability, a number of chunks of himself to a nearby location, landing towards visible nearby enemy champions and lasting for 6 seconds.
Cell Division.description3: Both Zac and his enemies can interact with these chunks by being within 50 units of them: Zac can move over them to consume them, restoring  4 / 5 / 6 / 7% (based on  Let's Bounce!'s rank) of his maximum health; enemies can move over them to destroy them.
Cell Division.description4: Periodically, upon taking fatal damage, Zac splits into 4 uncontrollable bloblets that move to his final location over 8 / 7 / 6 / 5 / 4 (based on level) seconds. If any of these bloblets remain at the end of the duration, Zac  recombines and returns at  10 - 50% maximum health.
Cell Division.description5: Upon splitting, the bloblets stop upon colliding with terrain.
Cell Division.notes:
* Cell Division's chunks spawn in two versions.
 Contestable: They will fall to the ground between Zac and the nearest  visible enemy champion within 1000 range of him (dropping slightly in Zac's favor). Cannot be interacted with for the first 0.25 seconds (except during  Let's Bounce!).
 Uncontestable: They will fall to the ground near Zac and can be picked up immediately (version used by default).

  Guardian Angel and  Chronoshift will take precedence over Cell Division.
  Spirit Visage increases the healing of both chunks and bloblets.
  Ryze's  Realm Warp is able to individually teleport Zac or his boblets during Cell Division.
 Cell Division's bloblets can be targeted by  teleport and are treated as if they were a  minion, becoming  invulnerable and  immobilized.
 Concurrent bloblets are not  interrupted and will continue to  recombine instinctively.

Stretching Strikes.name: Stretching Strikes
Stretching Strikes.blurb: Zac stretches an arm, grabbing an enemy. Attacking a different enemy will cause him to throw both targets towards each other.
Stretching Strikes.description: Active: Zac stretches his left arm in the target direction, dealing  magic damage and  slowing the first enemy hit by 40% for 0.5 seconds, and attaching it to the target for 2 seconds.
Stretching Strikes.description2: While his arm is attached, his next basic attack has  200 range and is replaced by a second Stretching Strike, dealing the same magic damage and  slow.
Stretching Strikes.description3: If the two Stretching Strikes affect different targets, he  roots both targets for 0.5 seconds and then  flings them towards each other for 300 range.
Stretching Strikes.description4: If the two targets are near each other, they're instead slammed against each other, both taking the initial magic damage and applied the  slow again.
Stretching Strikes.notes: *  Spell shields will block only one instance of damage.

Unstable Matter.name: Unstable Matter
Unstable Matter.blurb: Zac's body erupts, damaging nearby enemies.
Unstable Matter.description: Active: Zac's body explodes outward, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies, capped against  minions and  monsters, and becoming  ghosted for 5 seconds against monsters hit.
Unstable Matter.description2: Unstable Matter's  cooldown is reduced by 1 second every time Zac picks up a  Cell Division chunk.
Unstable Matter.notes: * Unstable Matter has no cast time and does not interrupt Zac's previous orders.

Elastic Slingshot.name: Elastic Slingshot
Elastic Slingshot.blurb: Zac attaches his arms to the ground and stretches back, launching himself forward.
Elastic Slingshot.description: Active: Zac channels up to 4.5 seconds, increasing Elastic Slingshot's  range over a cone in the target direction.
Elastic Slingshot.description2: Moving during the channel automatically cancels it, refunding 50% of the cost and  cooldown.
Elastic Slingshot.description3: Second Cast: Zac  dashes to the target location, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on impact and  knocking them up for 0.5 − 1 (based on duration of the charge) seconds.
Elastic Slingshot.notes: * Quick casting: Elastic Slingshot's channel begins when the key is pressed and held, launching Zac towards the cursor when released.

Let's Bounce!.name: Let's Bounce!
Let's Bounce!.description: Passive: Increases  Cell Division's healing from chunks.
Let's Bounce!.description2: Active: After a small delay, Zac bounces 4 times over 3 seconds, gaining 20% − 50% (based on duration) bonus movement speed, but becoming  disarmed and unable to use  Stretching Strikes and  Elastic Slingshot for the duration. There is a 1-second delay between each bounce.
Let's Bounce!.description3: Each bounce deals magic damage to all nearby enemies,  knocking them back for 1 second and subsequently  slowing them by 20% for the same duration.
Let's Bounce!.description4: Enemies can be damaged by multiple bounces, with each beyond the first dealing 50% damage but not  displacing them.
